Getting Started on Aion Wallet

  • It is important for you to understand the security implications for the safekeeping of your accounts on the Aion Network. You could lose access to funds you own on the Aion Network if the safekeeping of private keys and other best practices such as avoiding phishing sites are not followed

Introduction to Aion Wallet

  • Aion Wallet is a free, open-source, client-side interface to the Aion Network. Aion Wallet enables you to send and receive AION and monitor account balances on the Aion Network while having complete ownership of your keys and access to accounts
  • Ownership and security of accounts are your responsibility. Accounts cannot be frozen or retrieved if you lose ownership and secrecy of your private keys
  • We cannot recover your funds or freeze your account if lose your private key or ownership of an account

Functionality of the Aion Wallet

  • Aion Wallet is only an interface to the Aion Network when you create an account using the Aion Wallet a set cryptographic set of numbers - private key and public key also referred to as address is created. Keys generated are handled locally on your browser Aion Wallet doesn't keep a copy of your key
  • The private key generated is to access the account you own on the Aion Network, Aion Wallet doesn't transmit or store your private key. The private key is generated in the browser locally at the time of account generation and you must take care to secure the private key to access the account at a later time
  • Sharing private key means that you lose the sole ownership of the corresponding account on the Aion Network. You must never share your private key unless you intended to share ownership of an account
  • The public key/address is used to receive AION and tokens on the Aion Network. This address can be shared with other users on the network and is a your identifier on the network. An analogy that can be used is that the public address is similar to your bank account number that others can use to send funds to

The Aion Wallet has the following limitations

  • Access your account or make a transaction on your behalf
  • Recover private key to an account. If you lose ownership of your private key for an account it cannot be retrieved
  • Recover or reset your password
  • Reverse, cancel, or refund transactions
  • Freeze accounts

Security

  • If a you lose you private key or password, they cannot be retrieved
  • If you enter your private key on a phishing website, you lose sole ownership of your account and could lose all your funds

How To Protect Yourself from Phishers

Pishing is an attempt to steal personal infomration. Phishing websites are a common way that pishers attack users in the blockchain space. Phishing websites replicate the original website in all aspects, however phishing websites are made with a motive to steal private information, in this case your private key. There are many ways you can protect themself from phishsing websites, some of them are:
  • Always check the URL: https://wallet.aion.network
  • Always make sure the URL bar has AION WALLET LLC [US] in green
  • Bookmark the website in your browser and use the bookmark to naivgate to the website
  • Do not trust messages or links sent to you randomly via email, Slack, Reddit, Twitter, etc
  • Always navigate directly to a site before you enter any information. Do not enter information after clicking a link that redirects you to the website
  • Install an AdBlocker and do not click ads on your search engine (e.g. Google)

Securing your private key and password

If you lose your private key or password, it cannot be retrieved. It is important that the private key is secure from theft or loss. Following are some of the ways that the password and private key can be securely stored:
  • Make a backup of your private key and password. Print it out on a piece of paper or save it on a USB drive and secure the paper or USB drive in different physical locations
  • Do not store your private key in Dropbox, Google Drive, or other cloud storage. If that account is compromised, your keys and funds will be stolen
